info.label: Software Engineer at Microsoft
info.brief: I love working with passionate people who love what they do. I am a software engineer whose focus is helping others through the use of technology.  I enjoy connecting people with technology no matter the platform.

history.summary: A software company that develops, supports and sells software that serves enterprise and business needs of small to mid-size businesses.

.net, Blazor, Xamarin, Azure Service Fabric, Node, React, ReactXP, Redux, Electron

Store Fronts Data Service (SFDS): 
Rolled out a data service to support Microsoft's universal stores using Azure Service Fabric. 

Xbox Game Pass:
Helped release the latest version of the Game Pass application built with ReactXP and Electron.

CELA: 
Find Your Legal Contact (FYLC) - End-to-End utility to manage legal contact groups. Utilized by Microsoft employees, Azure pipelines and other internal applications. 

Insider Trading Compliance Tool (INTRACT) - platform to administer, notify and audit employee trading status. .net core with Blazor

Node, React, Redux, Corber, Cordova, Firebase, Wordpress
- Hybrid app (iOS, Android)

- Website

UI/UX focus working with design and development teams on part of the blue button initiative. Clickable mockups/prototypes, front end development and remote team/project management with a focus on 508 compliance.

history.position: New York Life Insurance Company - Licensed Insurance Agent
history.summary: An Agent through New York Life I worked with families, individuals and business owners to understand and get the most out of insurance, investments, company benefits and even individual health plans.

Consulting and volunteer work:
- Computer Systems Support
- Network and Systems Improvement Consulting
- Primary Computer Server Consultation + Build + Configure

HomeTown Tech is a team of computer service experts. We can fix broken computers (PC & Mac), set up a stronger & more secure network, provide computer training, and help you avoid computer problems.
Full-Stack Software Engineer, Agile Coach, Consultant, Advisor, Speaker, Mentor and Conference Organizer.

- Imaged and provisioned new hardware.

Yoga for First Responders provides vital emotional ­wellness and mental-resiliency training in academy settings, in­service trainings, and community-based programs.

48-hours of code 

A hackathon benefiting Iowa nonprofit organizations

https://dsmhack.org/the-hack/

FreeCodeCamp is a great community for those looking to learn as well as a great place for experienced developers to help the next generation of developers. 

As I Camp Counselor I help people work through the curriculum as well pair program with tools like screenhero, gitter and more. 

Just this week I have the privilege to work with a QA analyst from London. In her own words: 
 "I am a QA analyst but hoping to transition to front end devving asap"​

To find out more: 
http://freecodecamp.com/

An open source community of busy people who learn to code and build projects for nonprofits.

Our Mission: "To inspire youth to increase their knowledge and interest in technology by providing engaging learning opportunities led by technology professionals"

New York Life took part in "Keeping good going" by having teams of agents, staff and other volunteers help Amanda the Panda as they continued their remodel. We moved construction materials, cleaned up debris and organized supplies. Even though we carried out water heaters and other large items, Amanda the Panda is the one doing the real heavy lifting.

testimonials.name: Olivia Mead
testimonials.quote: Josh has turned our organization around with his knowledge of software and other technology that has improved the effectiveness of our mission. We are grateful and plan to continue to work with him.
